content.prompt: In which of the following scenarios would a presidential veto most likely be upheld?

choices.label: The President has the support of the Supreme Court.
The President is in a second term, removed from partisan politics.
The proposed legislation enjoys widespread bipartisan support.
The proposed legislation was originally adopted by a large majority in both houses of Congress.
Two-thirds of the representatives and senators are members of the same party as the President.

topic.text: 2.2: Structures, Powers, and Functions of Congress

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
